citation_title: Rethinking the Estate and Gift Tax: Overview
abstract: This paper surveys, integrates, and extends research on estate and gift taxes.  The paper begins with information on features of U.S. transfer taxes, characteristics of recent estate tax returns, the evolution of transfer taxes, the role of such taxes in other countries, and theory and evidence concerning why people give intergenerational transfers.  The next sections examine the incidence, equity, and efficiency of  transfer taxes.  Subsequent sections cover administrative issues and the effects on saving, labor supply, entrepreneurship, inter vivos gifts, charitable contributions, and capital gains realizations.  The paper closes with a discussion of policy options and a short conclusion.
